title: US pledges unwavering support for Sri Lanka’s anti-corruption drive
byline: The U.S. Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asian Affairs, Mr. Donald Lu has expressed the United States government’s commitment to supporting Sri Lanka’s on-going anti-corruption initiatives as needed during a meeting with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat today (07).

title: South Korea’s President survives impeachment vote after his party boycotts
byline: A South Korean legislative push to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol over his short-lived imposition of martial law fell through on Saturday after most lawmakers from his conservative governing party boycotted the vote.

title: Sri Lankan ‘tax collector’ elephant goes viral for stopping vehicles, seeking food
byline: Along the Buttala-Kataragama road in Sri Lanka, a majestic wild elephant, believed to be over 40 years old, performs the duties of a toll collector.

title: Teen drowns, 4 rescued as boat capsizes in Akkara Wissa Wewa
byline: A small boat has reportedly capsized with five children on board in the Akkara Wissa Wewa at Sellakataragama.

title: President sets maximum retail and wholesale prices for rice
byline: Following a discussion with rice traders, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has directed new maximum retail and wholesale price limits for various rice types, according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: Rameswaram fishermen protest seeking fishers’ release from Sri Lankan custody
byline: Hundreds of fishermen went on a strike in Rameshwaram on Saturday condemning the arrests of 14 Tamil Nadu fishermen by the Sri Lankan Navy and the seizure of their boats.

title: Showery conditions expected to enhance over several provinces
byline: The Department of Meteorology says the low-pressure area, formed over southeast Bay of Bengal, is likely to intensify further and move west-northwestwards during the next 24 hours.

title: CAA to inspect rice mills in Polonnaruwa
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has announced that it will conduct special inspections at rice mills in the Polonnaruwa area today (08).

title: South Korea ex-defence minister arrested over President Yoon’s martial law
byline: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s former defence minister was arrested on Sunday over his alleged role in Yoon’s declaration of martial law last week, prosecutors said.

title: PHIs launch island-wide inspections ahead of festive season
byline: The Public Health Inspectors’ Union (PHIU) says that a programme has been initiated to inspect food and beverages sold in areas with high public foot traffic, in preparation for the upcoming festive season.

title: Rebels declare Damascus ‘free’ as President Bashar al-Assad reportedly flees Syria
byline: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad boarded a plane and left Damascus for an unknown destination on Sunday, two senior army officers told Reuters, as rebels said they had entered the capital with no sign of army deployments.

title: 40% decline in salt production: Sri Lanka to import salt?
byline: The Ministry of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative Development states that the ministry will look into a reported decline in salt production within the country.

title: Sri Lanka failed to meet WHO food quality testing standards – Expert
byline: Sri Lanka has yet to conduct the necessary tests prescribed by the World Health Organization (WHO) to ensure food quality, Bio-Medical Scientist Dr. Kamal Gammanpila says.

title: Japan provides aid worth Rs. 300M to Sri Lanka flood victims
byline: The Japanese government has extended aid worth around Rs. 300 million to Sri Lanka to support people affected by the recent adverse weather conditions.

title: Census 2024: Department urges public to cooperate with enumerators
byline: The Department of Census and Statistics has assured the public that there is no cause for concern in providing information to enumerators conducting the ongoing Population and Housing Census 2024.

title: Imported rice stocks to arrive in Sri Lanka next week
byline: The Essential Food Commodities Importers & Traders Association says that the first shipment of imported rice will arrive in the island next week.

title: Sri Lanka’s ‘Ava’ gang leader arrested in Canada on murder charges
byline: A Sri Lankan national believed to be the head of the criminal gang known as ‘Ava Group’, based in Northern Sri Lanka, has been arrested in Canada.

title: Syrian government falls to fast-moving rebels, ending 50 years of iron rule by the Assad family
byline: The Syrian government collapsed early Sunday, falling to a lightning rebel offensive that seized control of the capital of Damascus and sent crowds into the streets to celebrate the end of the Assad family’s 50 years of iron rule.

title: Naval and fishing communities warned of strong winds and rough seas
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an advisory for heavy rain, strong winds and rough seas for multi-day boats in the Southeast Bay of Bengal deep sea areas.

title: Four arrested over series of gold thefts from taxi drivers
byline: Four individuals have been arrested for their involvement in a series of gold jewellery robberies targeting taxi drivers.
